body: We have several 5to6 documents where p5 aspects are discussed in detail. For the rest of the docs we should be assuming that the user has no perl 5 experience, and therefore mentions of perl 5 do nothing good. Here's a list with some false-positives: ``` Language/classtut.pod6:563:significant improvement over Perl 5's default approach Language/exceptions.pod6:17:Ad hoc exceptions work just like in Perl 5, where C is called with Language/testing.pod6:14:Perl 5 L Language/testing.pod6:161:Or via the L command from Perl 5, Language/faq.pod6:51:Windows Git and Strawberry Perl 5 to use zef to install library modules. Language/faq.pod6:117:=head2 I'm a Perl 5 programmer. Where is a list of differences between Perl 5 and Perl 6? Language/faq.pod6:133:Yes, it's the same L as for Perl 5! The only difference is Language/faq.pod6:151:=head2 Can I use Perl 5 modules from Perl 6? Language/faq.pod6:152:X<|Perl 5 modules (FAQ)> Language/faq.pod6:155:well with most Perl 5 modules. It can even run Perl 5 Catalyst and DBI. Language/faq.pod6:204:=head2 How can I dump Perl 6 data structures (like Perl 5 Data::Dumper and similar)? Language/faq.pod6:400:references doesn't make much sense. Unlike Perl 5, scalar variables Language/faq.pod6:585:Perl 5 has the L|/language/5to6-perlfunc#wantarray> function that Language/faq.pod6:657:The community considers Perl 5 and Perl 6 sister languages - they have Language/faq.pod6:659:intended to replace Perl 5. In fact, both languages interoperate with Language/faq.pod6:728:=item Interfacing with Perl 5 (CPAN) / Python modules trivially simple with Inline::Perl5 and Inline::Python. Language/faq.pod6:779:run faster than Perl 5. Language/faq.pod6:781:Perl 5 programmers should be aware that Perl 6 comes with more built-in Language/faq.pod6:783:things like Moose, type checking modules etc. in your Perl 5 script. Language/faq.pod6:786:show that Perl 6 can be faster than Perl 5 for similar tasks if Language/faq.pod6:787:the big weaponry is included; at the same time, Perl 5 can be faster Language/faq.pod6:807: # Perl 5 version Language/faq.pod6:822: # Another Perl 5 version that offers bare-bones set of features Language/glossary.pod6:507:when programming Perl 5. Language/glossary.pod6:517:Perl 5 Language/glossary.pod6:753:Name of the Perl 5 executor. Language/modules.pod6:415:of the colon (':') as with Perl 5 for C or C). Language/modules.pod6:509: C. It's quite similar to Perl 5's C. Language/quoting.pod6:342:quoting in a similar manner to the backticks a.k.a. C in Perl 5. There Language/quoting.pod6:374:corresponds to Perl 5's C): Language/regexes.pod6:34:As with Perl 5, comments work as usual in regexes. Language/regexes.pod6:235:The following list of Unicode General Categories is stolen from the Perl 5 Language/regexes.pod6:1507:=head3 Perl 5 compatibility adverb Language/regexes.pod6:1510:to the way Perl 5 regexes behave: Language/traps.pod6:334:In Perl 5 one could reference the last element of an array by asking for the Language/traps.pod6:528:should be; loosely treating the strings as numbers in a large base. Here's Perl 5 version: Language/traps.pod6:549:To achieve simpler behaviour, similar to the Perl 5 example above, use a sequence operator that calls C<.succ> method on the Language/variables.pod6:417: $~P5Regex the current root of the Perl 5 regex language Language/variables.pod6:917:Perl 5 is infamous for its many obscure special variables. Perl 6 also has Programs/01-debugging.pod6:68:This is in spirit similar to Perl 5's L hash constructor, as braces Type/Str.pod6:526:Perl 5 (non-)compatibility: HomePage.pod6:63:Documentation for the different but related Perl 5 language HomePage.pod6:64:can be found on the Perl 5 documentation website. ```
title: Get rid of Perl5 mentions from non-5to6 docs
